pros: Fabulous ethos and commitment to the Autistic community
cons: Multiple working sites across vast areas

job_title: Occupational Therapist in Lismore, New South Wales
pros: - great supervision - large team - neurodiverse affirming
cons: - not a competitive salary - superannuation is inclusive in salary

pros: The best team and most caring manger. They were very focused on the employees well being alongside the support and success of the client.
cons: There are challenging situations although I felt supported through them.
Manager is too busy to manage everyone

pros: Being able to connect with supporters or clients of Autism Spectrum Australia (Aspect).
cons: The expectation to produce big results with absolute bare minimum resources. Very isolated working environment with no collaboration between team members or with other teams. Poor leadership, with middle management not leading by example and also not trusting their staff, leading to low morale and reduced motivation. Short-term quick fixes are always used instead of long-term solutions. Mixed messaging about people's roles, resulting in inefficiencies. Run down facilities at head office and lack of amenities.

review_title: A company that recognizes and fosters talemt
pros: Professional, encouraging, working alongside like minded people
cons: On the schads award, so can be low

pros: Some of the frontline workers are really nice and very professional.
cons:
there is a definate lack of leadership. Management expect you to have esp to know what they want. No help, understaffed with unrealistic expectations. 
Enter with eyes wide open.

review_title: Not a Nice Place to Work
cons: Management are bullies, little to no resources.

pros: Great working environment with friendly staff members. Loved being able to travel to different client homes and provide therapy to children aged up to seven. You build such strong connections with families. Great starting pay for a therapist. Lots of resources for you to use. Given a company car or you can drive your own car for monthly mileage reimbursement.
cons: Get ready to put in lots of extra work beyond a typical 8hr day. You do provide lots of resources to not only your direct client (child) but also to parents. While you are building strong connections, there will be times when you become through deep emotional moments.
